title: More than 1 in 4 French gas stations out of at least one fuel
description: Some 28.5% -- nearly one third -- of gas stations in mainland France are out of stock of at least one fuel, French Energy Transition Minister Agnes Pannier-Runacher told journalists Friday.

title: Liz Truss was defeated by the bond market. Investors aren't satisfied yet
description: After a bruising three-week battle with bond markets, UK Prime Minister Liz Truss admitted defeat on Friday. She fired her finance minister and gutted her economic program by promising to reinstate a big tax hike on corporations.

title: A 'tectonic shift' in global wealth that will take years to recover from
description: Markets plunged on Thursday morning after red-hot inflation data raised fears on Wall Street that the Federal Reserve would continue hiking interest rates aggressively. Then, something strange happened.

title: A sense of crisis has defined Xi's rule. It will shape China well into the future
description: When Xi Jinping came to power in 2012, he inherited a country at a crossroads.

title: India halts production of cough syrups suspected of links to child deaths
description: Indian health authorities have halted production at a pharmaceutical company in New Delhi after the World Health Organization (WHO) said its cough and cold syrups may be linked to the deaths of dozens of children.

title: Anger at China's zero-Covid policy is rising, but Beijing refuses to change course
description: A young woman stands on her balcony, crying out in desperation after her building was ordered into lockdown.
